title: Hongkong United Dockyards
text:
Hongkong United Dockyards () abbreviated to United Dockyards () or HUD is a <a href="dockyard">dockyard</a> built on the site of the former Shek Wan or "Stone Bay" (), on <a href="Tsing%20Yi">Tsing Yi Island</a> of <a href="Hong%20Kong">Hong Kong</a>.
History.
HUD was formed in 1973 from the merger of the <a href="Hong%20Kong%20and%20Whampoa%20Dock">Hong Kong and Whampoa Dock</a> (1863) and the <a href="Taikoo%20Dockyard">Taikoo Dockyard</a> (1902 or 1905). It is jointly owned by <a href="CK%20Hutchison">CK Hutchison</a> and <a href="Swire">Swire</a>. The HUD facilities in Tsing Yi replaced the <a href="Whampoa%20Dockyard">Whampoa Dockyard</a> in <a href="Hung%20Hom">Hung Hom</a>, which became the <a href="Whampoa%20Garden">Whampoa Garden</a> estate, and the <a href="Taikoo%20Dockyard">Taikoo Dockyard</a> in <a href="Quarry%20Bay">Quarry Bay</a>, which became the <a href="Taikoo%20Shing">Taikoo Shing</a> estate.

The company employs over 400 people including subcontractors to perform repairs.
The named United was added when it was acquired in 1995.
Facilities.
Instead of a fixed dockyard, it uses a 40,000t floating dockyard to perform repairs in Tsing Yi. There are two berths for ships being repaired but not requiring to be placed in the floating dock.
The dockyard has four Ramparts 3000 ASD tugs used to tow ships into the facility.
